root: ^Lanri walks into your terminal room, in response to your summons, unusually calm and controlled. "You want to know why I asked you to make sure my various research notes quiet, right?"

^Confirming her astute guess, you ask her to continue. "I don't want it being misused. Sharing information is important to scientific progress, but, no offense, I don't trust Kellis to make it easily accessible. I expect them to keep it private and use it...maliciously."
^"Kellis has misused your research before? Could you explain?"
^"I will respect your privacy. You can do as you wish with your research?"
^"That research was done while employed by Kellis. It belongs to them."

PosRes1: ^Lanri seems suspicious with your answer. "Are you sincere? Or are you just saying that to please me?" After promising your sincerity, she perks up. "Thank you so much. I love doing research and learning new things. There's just this fear that it will be misused and hidden from others."
^She turns to leave, before turning back and adding one more remark. "And thanks for not asking about the past." And with that, she leaves.
NeuRes1: ^Her face darkens and she looks away. "I'm not going into it. Are you okay with me keeping my research private?"
^"I will respect your privacy. You can do as you wish with your research?"
^"That research was done while employed by Kellis. It belongs to them."
NegRes1: ^Your response gets her fuming. "What's the point of doing research to help people when that research can only be used by those working for a corporation?" Anticipating a reply, she cuts you off. "And trust me, they won't be using it for good. They will use it increase their bottom line, consequences be damned."
^With that, she storms out of the room.
PosRes2: ^Lanri seems suspicious with your answer. "Are you sincere? Or are you just saying that to please me?" After promising your sincerity, she perks up. "Thank you so much. I love doing research and learning new things. There's just this fear that it will be misused and hidden from others." And with that, she leaves.
